events.message: The applicant submitted a personal loan application to cover upcoming medical expenses for a scheduled surgery.
The loan application was reviewed and categorised under personal loans due to the applicant's stated use for medical bills.
A loan officer was assigned to the case to provide personalized support and assist with the loan processing.
The initial review of the applicant's financial history and stated purpose was completed to assess loan eligibility.
Documents related to recent medical bills, proof of income, and identification were requested to support the loan application.
The applicant submitted all requested documents, including medical invoices and income statements, on time.
The credit check was successfully completed, confirming the applicant's creditworthiness without any outstanding issues.
Risk assessment was performed considering the applicant’s credit score and repayment capacity with moderate risk identified.
A personal loan offer was presented to the applicant including terms and repayment schedule tailored for medical expense coverage.
The applicant responded positively to the loan offer, requesting minor clarifications about the interest rate and payment period.
Due to the applicant’s questions and request for clarification, the application was escalated to a senior loan officer for further review.
Following satisfactory clarifications and detailed review, the personal loan for medical expenses was formally approved.
The loan amount was successfully disbursed into the applicant's bank account, enabling the coverage of all planned medical costs.
A follow-up was conducted to ensure the applicant is managing repayments well and to offer assistance if necessary.
The loan application case was officially closed after successful disbursement and initial follow-up confirming applicant satisfaction.
